titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Clemmence G. Hayworth papers, 1867-1877
titlestmt.author: Processed by: Rubenstein Staff; EAD finding aid derived from MARC record using marc2ead_sectionA.xsl

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid derived from MARC record via marc2ead_sectionA.xsl, November 2021

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

did.abstract: A letter, 1867, appointing Hayworth an election official in his county; letters from J.E. Hayworth in Hendrix County, Indiana, describing conditions there and remarking on the effect of the railroad strike of 1877; and a tax evaluation list for 1868.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.p: Clemmence G. Hayworth Papers, 1867-1877, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.p: This finding aid was derived from a MARC record using a crosswalk defined in marc2ead_sectionA.xsl. The finding aid was generated as part of a larger project to digitize several thousand small collections housed in Section A, November 2021.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Clemmence G. Hayworth was a resident of Randolph County, North Carolina.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: A letter, 1867, appointing Hayworth an election official in his county; letters from J.E. Hayworth in Hendrix County, Indiana, describing conditions there and remarking on the effect of the railroad strike of 1877; and a tax evaluation list for 1868.
